intro: Browallia peduncularis, commonly known as the slender browallia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. The flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems, making it a visually striking addition to gardens and natural habitats.
